Dear Ms. French:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10123 Staff Sufficiency
Section (1) A facility shall have a staffing pattern of administrative,
Description supervisory, direct care, and other staff sufficient to perform the
prescribed functions required by these administrative rules and to
provide for the needs, protection, and supervision of the residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Between April and November, youth was in and out of facility.
During that time youth and two other youth touched each other in
a sexual manner. On a separate occasion, youth used their
hands to touch another youth's vaginal area and the touch was
unwanted.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source/Director was interviewed via phone on
November 28, 2023. Director reported Administrator met with Youth
A and Youth A’s Probation Officer to complete a post-discharge
check-in and this is where the allegations were reported. She
reported Youth A disclosed that sometime in April 2023, she was
sitting on the unit in between two male youth and she touched them
inappropriately. Director reported Youth A believed a staff member
was sitting on the other side of the room looking through a book
during the time it happened. She reported Youth A disclosed in
September that Youth B had touched her inappropriately when she
was sitting next to him. Director reported Youth A reported two staff
members were talking during the time the touch occurred. Director
reported Youth A did not know who the staff were that were working
and would not disclose who the two other youth were in April 2023.
Director reported Youth A is a sexualized youth and had to be placed
on her own pod due to reported concerns of Youth A flashing others
and completing self-gratification acts in front of others. Director
reported the video recordings in the facility do not go back to the time
frames Youth A disclosed. She also reported there is a rule at the
facility that male and female youth cannot sit next to one another.
Law Enforcement was interviewed via phone on November 29,
2023. Law Enforcement reported he is still reviewing the allegations
and stated this consultant can move forward with the investigation on
their own.
2

Youth A was interviewed via phone on November 29,
2023. Youth A reported sometime in April 2023 two male peers kept
grabbing her butt while she was walking around the living area when
staff were not looking. Youth A reported she never told anyone about
this situation because it was not a big deal. She reported she does
not remember who the two male peers were or who the staff was that
was present when this occurred. Youth A disclosed in September
2023, Youth B had touched her vagina over her pants under a table
when they were sitting next to one another. Youth A reported staff did
not see this occur because it was under the table. She reported the
staff at the time was sitting in the room but was looking at a book
when it occurred. Youth A reported she did not remember who the
staff was that was working and stated that she did not want to press
charges against Youth B. She reported she had notified
Administrator of this incident occurring. Youth A reported when she
told Administrator she was then moved to her own pod and nothing
else happened. She reported all staff supervise the youth there and
but the youth are sneaky. Youth A reported these two times were the
only times she was touched inappropriately, and it was done when
staff were not looking.
Youth B was interviewed virtually face to face on November 30,
2023. Youth B reported staff were always watching the youth and
redirecting any inappropriate behaviors. Youth B denied ever
touching anyone inappropriately, including Youth A. He reported no
one ever touched him inappropriately at the facility. Youth B reported
that if he did have concerns while he was at the facility, he had staff
he felt he could report to but never had any concerns to report.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 30, 2023. Administrator reported Youth A disclosed on
September 20, 2023, that a youth at the facility had done an
unwanted touch to her vagina. She reported when Youth A made that
disclosure, she stated she did not know who the youth was that
touched her or the date that this occurred. Youth A at the time told
Administrator to review the video footage for the past month or longer
to see when the touch occurred. Administrator reported she reviewed
video footage and never saw any concerns of Youth A sitting next to
another youth or being touched by another youth. Administrator
reported due to that disclosure, Youth A was put on special
programming and put on a pod alone to keep her safe. She reported
on November 27, 2023, she met with Youth A and Probation Officer
1 to do a check-in post Youth A’s discharge. Youth A reported in that
meeting in April 2023, she touched two male peers’ private parts
inappropriately when sitting on the couch. She reported during that
time the staff on the pod that was supervising them was working on a
crossword puzzle. Youth A reported in September 2023, that Youth B
had touched her inappropriately. Administrator reported the meeting
3

on November 27, 2023, was the first time Youth A disclosed Youth B
as the person that did the unwanted touch. Administrator reported
when they reviewed the video back in September she reported she
never saw Youth B sitting next to Youth A. She reported if Youth A
was to come back to the facility, they would keep her on a
specialized plan of being on her own pod. Administrator reported
there were reports from prior youth of Youth A trying to be in a
relationship with them and making them feel uncomfortable. Youth A
flashed her breasts at other youth and refused to wear a bra.
Administrator reported Youth A did not know which staff were
working when the incident occurred and stated she did not know who
the two male peers were in April.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were all individually interviewed
faced to face at the facility on November 30, 2023. Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 3 reported they all were working during the time periods of
Youth A and Youth B being placed at the facility. They all reported
being aware of Youth A’s sexualized behavior and were made aware
of all her safety planning. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 reported Youth
A never disclosed to them of being touched inappropriately by
anyone at the facility. Staff 1 reported the main concern with Youth A
was her attempting to show other youth her breasts by flashing them
and had to be redirected to sit appropriately in chairs. They all
reported Youth A had to have close eyes on supervision. All the staff
members reported they had never seen Youth A and Youth B sit next
to one another. They reported all youth are to keep appropriate
space when sitting as no one can sit directly next to one another. All
the staff members reported they did not have concerns about any of
the other staff members' ability to supervise the youth at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
30, 2023. Youth C reported his only concern at the facility is that staff
are strict on them and do not allow the male and female youth to
socialize with one another. He reported staff are always supervising
him if he was to talk to a female youth. Youth C reported males and
females are not allowed to sit next to one another. He reported he
heard a rumor of Youth A saying she was touched by Youth B, but he
reported he had never seen anything happen when they were placed
together. Youth C reported he does not have any concerns with the
staff’s level of supervision.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on November
30, 2023. Youth D reported she was residing at the facility when
Youth A was living there. She reported she was friends with Youth A
and noted she tried to get into a relationship with all the youth. Youth
D reported Youth A was really wanting to get pregnant, but no one
wanted to be with her. Youth D reported Youth A told her if none of
the youth wanted to be with her, she was going to make up lies about
4

the youth touching her because she wanted the attention. Youth D
reported the staff regulates all the interactions with males and
females on the unit and they are not allowed to sit next to one
another. She reported it can be frustrating because staff redirect the
youth even when they talk to one another.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on December 4, 2023. Staff 4
reported she works the night shift and was there when Youth A was
placed there. She stated Youth A was highly sexualized youth where
she had to be redirected to sit appropriately and be reminded of
appropriate space around staff. She reported Youth A had to be
redirected for appropriate spacing as well around other youth. Staff 4
reported for all male and female youth there should always be
spacing on the couch and at tables when in the pods. She reported
staff should always have their eyes on and ears open when
supervising the youth. Staff 4 reported Youth A has never disclosed
of anyone touching her inappropriately. She reported Youth B
reported he wanted nothing to do with Youth A and she never saw
him sit by Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on December 5, 2023. Staff 5
reported she works the night shift at the facility and was working at
the facility when both Youth A and Youth B were placed there. She
reported no youth reported that they were touched inappropriately at
the facility. Staff 5 reported staff are always watching the youth on
the pods and the males and females cannot be sitting next to one
another. Staff 5 reported all the staff are always communicating with
one another to make sure all behaviors of the youth are being
reported. She reported when Youth A was placed at the facility, she
was highly sexualized by making comments, trying to show her
breast, and would have to be redirected for shaking her butt. Staff 5
reported Administrator would make sure that all staff were updated
with Youth A’s safety plans and be mindful of her behaviors. She
reported Youth A would always tell people she was in relationships
with others and none of this was ever true.
Probation Officer 1 was interviewed via phone on November 29,
2023. Probation Officer 1 is Youth A’s Probation Officer. Probation
Officer 1 reported Youth A had disclosed to her these allegations.
She reported she has been assigned to Youth A’s case for about a
month now and Youth A did not disclose these concerns to her until
she was discharged from the facility. She reported she has discussed
these allegations with Youth A and Mother, and both have reported
they do not want to press charges on Youth B. Probation Officer 1
reported these allegations raised concerns with her about the level of
supervision the youth are receiving from staff. She reported before
these allegations she had no concerns with the facility. Probation
Officer 1 reported Youth A is a sexualized youth and Youth A had to
5

be moved into her own pod while in the facility due to concerns about
sexualized behaviors that were inappropriate in front of other youth.
Mother was interviewed via phone on November 29, 2023.
Mother is Youth A’s Mother. Mother reported she had no concerns
with the facility while Youth A was placed there. She reported Youth
A had never disclosed these allegations to her and did not hear
about them until the other day from Probation Officer 1. Mother
reported she had no other information to provide at this time.
Probation Officer 2 was interviewed via phone on November 28,
2023. Probation Officer 2 is Youth B’s Probation Officer. Probation
Officer 2 reported there had been no concerns about Youth B being
mistreated at the facility when he was placed there. He reported
there were no concerns of sexual activity occurring or concerns with
supervision.
Documents Reviewed:
-Facility Incident report dated 11/27/2023- This incident report is
the documentation of Administrator meeting with Youth A and Youth
A’s Probation Officer of the disclosure of the touching. This incident
report is consistent with Administrator’s interview.
- Facility Incident report dated 09/20/2023- This incident report is
the documentation of Administrator receiving the disclosure form
Youth A that an unknown peer on an unknown date. This incident
reported is consistent with Administrator’s interview. Actions that
were taken by Administrator was the review of video footage with no
evidence found and moving Youth A to a solo unit for her protection.
-Youth A’s Facility File- Youth A was placed the facility during three
different time periods: 04/14/23 to 06/07/23, 08/17/23 to 10/06/23,
and 11/8/23 to 11/22/23. Youth A’s File had incident reports that
listed concerning sexualized behaviors. On 04/27/23, Youth A was
redirected several times for sexually explicit behaviors. On 09/18/23,
Youth A was talked to about wearing appropriate undergarments
along with not flashing youth. On 11/16/23, Youth A was caught
flashing the youth on the unit her breast and the youth reported
feeling uncomfortable about this. The incident report notes Youth A is
not allowed to be other youth at this time due to hypersexualized
behaviors.
- Youth B’s Facility File- There was no incident reports within Youth
B’s file for sexualized behaviors or safety plans.
- Emails from Administrator to all staff- Email dated 05/23/23 a
reminder to staff that Youth A is to not to sit next to any male peers
and is wearing proper undergarments. Reminder to staff that Youth A
6

has experience sexualized trauma and needs to be redirected
appropriately. Email dated 09/18/23 a reminder to all staff to continue
to have appropriate supervision of female youth. Email dated
09/20/23, a reminder Youth A is now sleeping in her own pod due to
the allegations reported of an inappropriate touch. Reminder Youth A
should not be sitting at a table or next to any male youth. Email dated
09/22/23, an email to all staff about Youth A’s special programing.
Which included Youth A being on her own pod, making sure if she is
in with others she should be closest to staff, and she is to not sit next
to any of her peers when in the classroom or activities.
- Helpful Tips for youth Success- Document that is hung within the
pod and emailed out to all staff on 09/03/2021. This document has a
list of safety reminder for staff including they are to position
themselves appropriately to observe all youth’s movements and hand
placements appropriately.
- Facility Employee Handbook- The employee handbook notes a
do’s and don’t section for staff to review. Within this section it notes
that staff should, “be alert and watchful at all times. As much as
possible, position yourself to see and hearing everything that is going
on in the group. When moving individuals or groups from one area to
another, always walk behind the residents.” Prison Rape Elimination
Act (PREA) documentation is given to all new employees and a video
is also watched to explain the importance of eliminating the
possibility of rape in these congregate settings.
- Safety and Security Pod Management Training workbook- This
training occurs for all staff during new worker orientation. This
training reviews the importance of constant supervision of the youth
and the appropriate spacing that should occur between the youth
when on the pod or moving to new activities.
-Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention brochure- This
brochure is given to all the youth at the facility to make sure they are
aware of their body safety and appropriate boundaries. This brochure
informs the youth if there is an uncomfortable situation that arise to
inform a staff member or administrator immediately.
Analysis There was no evidence found to support Youth A had been
touched inappropriately by Youth B or touched other youth. The
facility was found in compliance with following their safety
protocols and supervision of youth at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
12/12/2023
___________________________________________
